title: Exercise: Define Schema from an External Dataset

questions.question: Why did you check the box for CommunityMap but not Parks in step 4?
options: Dynamic writing does not work for MITAB datasets.
Selecting Parks will cause an error because there are conflicting schema definitions for the same feature type.
We want the written Parks data to take its schema from the CommunityMap geodatabase, not the Parks MITAB file.

questions.question: Why does OBJECTID appear in the output in step 5?
options: The CommunityMap [FILEGDB] Schema Source has a table named Parks that has this column.
We defined it manually using the User Attributes tab.
All GML feature types must contain this attribute.
All feature types, regardless of format, must contain this attribute.

questions.question: Why don't attributes values appear in the written data for the newly-defined schema?
options: These attributes all have missing values in the source data.
Dynamic writer feature types cannot write attribute values.
The schema definition mode is configured incorrectly.
They are dynamically defined on the writer feature type, but the incoming features do not have matching attributes. The workspace must map the old schema onto the new one.
